etymology.description: 看(看) (kàn, "look") + 一(一) (yī, "one") + 看(看) (kàn, "look") indicates the act of taking a quick or casual glance at something. The repetition of 看(看) (kàn, "look") emphasizes the act, while 一(一) (yī, "one") signifies a single or brief instance.
etymology.interpretation: 看一看 (kàn yī kàn) suggests a quick or casual glance at something, implying it is a brief or singular view without detailed examination.

examples.chinese: 请你看一看(請你看一看)，那幅画好美丽(那幅畫好美麗)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ kàn yī kàn, nà fú huà hǎo měilì.
examples.english: Please take a look, that painting is beautiful.

examples.chinese: 到了展览馆(到了展覽館)，先看一看(先看一看)，再挑选喜欢的作品(再挑選喜歡的作品)。
examples.pinyin: Dào le zhǎnlǎn guǎn, xiān kàn yī kàn, zài tiāo xuǎn xǐhuān de zuòpǐn.
examples.english: Upon arriving at the exhibition hall, take a look first, then select the artwork you like.
